result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed/stayed, consecutive to the sentence in 16CF103.  Huber.
Consecutive to: 16CF103

Conditions: Pay court costs. Submit to AODA and follow through with the recommendations. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming order by the agent. 

Expungement to be afforded per 973.015 upon successfull completion of probation. Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding this procedure when the time comes.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Several cases called together for status:  16CF103, 16CF119, 16CF120, 16CF121, 16CM112, 16TR1578, and initial in 16CT94 (filed today).  Defendant Thomas M Larson in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of these matters.  Per the DA, details of the agreement call for the following:  

16CF103:  1) delivery of THC  2) mis. bail jumping 3) possession of THC - Def to plea to counts2 and 3 for dismissal/read in of ct 1; proposed sentence: ct 2 --6 months jail i/s w/probation for two years, costs, AODA; ct 3 -- 30 days jail concurrent i/s for probation of two years, costs, AODA  
 
16CF119, 16CF120, and 16CF121 to be dismissed and read in. 
  
16CM112:  1) possession of THC  2) paraphernalia  3)  operating w/restricted controlled substance with minor passenger - Def to plea to ct 1; remaining counts to be DRI; proposed sentence for ct 1 - 6 months jail i/s, consecutive, for two years probation, same conditions as above.  
 
16CT94 (filed today; one count of OWI 1st with a minor passenger in the vehicle) - Def to plead to the single count for $1379, 10 days jail, 12 months rev, AODA/driver safety plan.  No blood draw reimbursement requested or ordered.

16TR1578 to be dismissed/read in.
                   
Further, parties are jointly requesting expungement in all matters EXCEPT for 16CT94.  Counsel stipulate to 26 days credit, 10 of which are to be applied for use in the 16CT94 case.

Def pleads no contest to the charges stated, the initial appearance having been completed in 16CT94  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.
 
Counsel and Def address the Court.  DA asks that, as further conditions of probation, def not to have contact with TC or JD.  Def asks that the Court not imposed the no contact with JD.

Sentence:  Court follows jt recommendation.  16CT94 - sentence is $350 plus costs, 10 days jail, 12 mo revocation, AODA/driver safety plan.  26 days credit - 10 of those to be applied to the jail time in 16CT94 so that term of sentence will be considered completed.

16CF103 - ct 2 - 6 months jail; ct 3 - 30 days jail; concurrent.  Imposed/stayed for 2 years probation with conditions that def pay one set of costs, have AODA and follow through with recommendation; attend, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.  Remaining 16 days credit to be applied to this case.

16CM112 - ct 2 - 6 months jail imposed/stayed CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in 16CF103, for 2 years probation with same conditions and one set of costs.

Court finds in both 16CF103 and 16CM112 for expungement per 973.015.  

All of the other cases and counts to be dismissed and read in.
Notice of Right to seek Postconviction relief.
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Several cases called together for arraignment:  16CF103, 16CF119, 16CF120, 16CF121, 16CM112, and 16TR1578.  Defendant Thomas M Larson in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA informs the Court that the parties have a proposed agreement to resolve these matters.  DA Harper recites the agreement:

In 16CF103, agreement calls for dismissal/read-in of Count 1 and pleas to Counts 2 and 3 for 6 mo jail imposed/stayed on Count 2 and probation on that count as well as Count 3 with conditions of costs, AODA, and treatment as recommended by the agent.

16CF119, 16CF120, 16CF121, and 16TR1578 to be dismissed/read-in in their entirety.

In 16CM112, Def to plead to Counts 1 and 3.  For Count 1, parties recommend 6 mo jail, imposed/stayed, consecutive to the jail imposed/stayed in 16CF103, with the same 2 years probation and conditions.  For Count 3, the operating with restricted controlled substance count, agreement calls for 10 days jail, $1379, 12 mo revocation, no IID requirement, and essentially a time-served sentence as def has 26 days credit.  DA has asked for expungement on Count 1/possession of THC, but not expungement of Count 3/operating w/restricted count.  Clerk notes to Court issues with single-count expungement.  Court questions parties about the expungement part of their resolution.  DA states that she will correct this issue but refiling the operating w/restricted substance count as a separate case.

Matters all adjourned to 12/14 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Several cases called together for prelim in 15CF119, 16CF120, 16CF103, and 16CF121, status in 16CM112, and status in 16TR1578.  Defendant Thomas M Larson in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  In the prelim cases, def waives right to prelim, Atty. Angel presents prelim waiver to the Court, and Court conducts colloquy.  Arraignment/status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Defendant Thomas M Larson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas M Larson appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody.  Several matters called together:  adjourned initial in 16CF103, 16CF119, and 16CM112; initial in 16CF120 and 16CF121, along with 16TR1578 status.  Prelims requested and set in the felony cases.  Statuses set in the CM and TR cases.  NG pleas entered in the CM case.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas M Larson in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 16CM112 and 16CF103 called together. Court reads complaints, informs def of charges, poss. max penalties and rights to counsel.  Def states he has called SPD. Matters adjourned to 11-02-16.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
